text: hi everyone uh
here the internet's busiest music nerd
and it's time for a review of this new
portrayal of guilt
album we are always alone this is the
second full-length album from austin
texas metal outfit portrayal of guilt
which follows the release of their
blistering debut a few years ago let
pain be your guide
where the band delivered a violent and
volatile mixture of black metal
and screamo now it should be mentioned
this group is obviously not the first to
find common ground between these sounds
death heaven will most likely remain to
be the most
notable band to do such but that doesn't
mean there isn't room to
experiment and portrayal of gilt's
direct and ferocious approach is
certainly a contrast from the
shoe gaze atmospheric black metal that
was trendy the year sunbather dropped
we are always alone present some pretty
explosive blast beat
passages just roaring with bass and
guitar
played impeccably well too the band is
phenomenally tight
on these tracks the production's crystal
clear on this thing too
every drum and every distorted bass lick
hits in high definition
the more atmospheric passages are
shadowy and enveloping
whoever engineered this thing has
god-like ears but with all of the great
things
portrayal of guilt has going for
themselves on this project
it's just surprising to hear so many
other things that just
sound unambitious frankly the vocals for
one
and there are a lot of harsh vocals on
this project varied vocals as well
black metal wretches screamos screams as
well as some despondent moany spoken
word in the second half of the
song my immolation so again a lot of
different vocals
on this record but never a standout
vocal
even the way the band transitions from
one vocal style to the next isn't
entirely unique or distinct
the occasional gang choruses are maybe
the most memorable moments on the record
vocally speaking but
even they aren't so great they can carry
the entire project
to an extent i have to make the same
case for the guitar and bass
tone on this thing as well look like i
said earlier the record is engineered
very well it's very loud it hits hard it
is somewhat dynamic too but
there is just so little flavor to the
tone of these guitars and bass in its
best moments this project to my ear
sounds like the more pummeling passages
of behemoths the satanist
but with way less compositional skill
and instrumental ambition
then there's the writing again i will
say the sound of this record hits hard
and the performances are hyper
aggressive but the rifts and leads on
most of these tracks are absolutely not
out to impress
or really leave much of a memory behind
especially on some of the shorter and
more frenzied tracks here
attempting plan the second coming
slightly longer songs in the track list
like anesthetized as well as it's
already over
do feature some more compelling grooves
as well as dynamic song structures
but they're still lacking in something
to just sort of push
things over the top no matter how hard
the band goes
their sound and their writing just comes
off very meat and potatoes
still though i do see potential in some
of the longest songs on this record like
six time oath as well as garden of
despair where i have to give the band
credit for creating a series of passages
that contrast nicely while also fluidly
transitioning into each other
just really building and switching up
the momentum nicely as we move from
chilling lows
to enraged highs but maybe the most
unimpressive thing about all these
tracks are the various non-endings
at the finish of them where instead of
writing something to really tie things
up the band will suddenly break into a
totally unexpected sound effect or piece
of instrumentation that
has a much different texture than
everything we've heard up until this
point
usually to initiate a chilling vibe of
some sort when
honestly if you had access to all these
interesting sounds
you you could have just used them in the
songs
themselves certainly would break things
up more effectively than just popping
them in
as a replacement for a proper finish but
to sum things up i enjoyed this record
on the whole
and certainly it has great performances
fantastic production
seems like the band has a solid
conception of song structure too
and while the vocals and the sound play
and the writing weren't necessarily
terrible they were clearly lacking and i
hope to see the band push further on
those fronts into the future
feeling a light to decent six on this
one tran position have you given
this album a listen did you love it did
you hate it what would you rate it
you're the best you're the best what
should i review next
hit the like if you like please
subscribe and please don't cry hit the
bell as well
over here next to my head is another
video that you can check out hit that up
or the link to subscribe to the channel
anthony fantano portrayal of guilt
forever
